  shows "(\<lambda>n. u n/n) \<longlonglongrightarrow> Inf {u n/n | n. n>0}"

text \<open>Hahn-Banach in euclidean spaces: given a vector $u$, there exists a unit norm
vector $v$ such that $\langle u, v \rangle = \|u\|$ (and we put a minus sign as we will
use it in this form). This uses the fact that, in Isabelle/HOL, euclidean spaces
have positive dimension by definition.\<close>

lemma select_unit_norm:
  fixes u::"'a::euclidean_space"
  shows "\<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u
proof (cases "u = 0")

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. u = (0::'a) \<Longrightarrow>
    \<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u
 2. u \<noteq> (0::'a) \<Longrightarrow>
    \<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u
case True

proof (state)
this:
  u = (0::'a)

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. u = (0::'a) \<Longrightarrow>
    \<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u
 2. u \<noteq> (0::'a) \<Longrightarrow>
    \<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u
then

proof (chain)
picking this:
  u = (0::'a)
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  u = (0::'a)

goal (1 subgoal):

using norm_Basis nonempty_Basis

  Basis \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):

  \<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u

goal (1 subgoal):

    \<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> v \<bullet> u = - norm u

text \<open>We set up the assumption that we will use until the end of this file,
in the following locale: we fix a semicontraction $T$ of a euclidean space.
Our goal will be to show that such a semicontraction has an asymptotic translation vector.\<close>

locale Kohlberg_Neyman_Karlsson =
  fixes T::"'a::euclidean_space \<Rightarrow> 'a"
  assumes semicontract: "dist (T x) (T y) \<le> dist x y"
begin
text \<open>The iterates of $T$ are still semicontractions, by induction.\<close>

lemma semicontract_Tn:
  "dist ((T^^n) x) ((T^^n) y) \<le> dist x y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. dist ((T ^^ n) x) ((T ^^ n) y) \<le> dist x y
apply (induction n, auto)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n.
       dist ((T ^^ n) x) ((T ^^ n) y) \<le> dist x y \<Longrightarrow>
       dist (T ((T ^^ n) x)) (T ((T ^^ n) y)) \<le> dist x y
using semicontract order_trans

proof (prove)
using this:
  dist (T ?x) (T ?y) \<le> dist ?x ?y
  \<lbrakk>?x \<le> ?y; ?y \<le> ?z\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> ?x \<le> ?z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n.
       dist ((T ^^ n) x) ((T ^^ n) y) \<le> dist x y \<Longrightarrow>
       dist (T ((T ^^ n) x)) (T ((T ^^ n) y)) \<le> dist x y
by blast

text \<open>The main quantity we will use is the distance from the origin to its image under $T^n$.
We denote it by $u_n$. The main point is that it is subadditive by semicontraction, hence
it converges to a limit $A$ given by $Inf \{u_n/n\}$, thanks to Fekete Lemma.\<close>

definition u::"nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  where "u n = dist 0 ((T^^n) 0)"

definition A::real
  where "A = Inf {u n/n | n. n>0}"
lemma Apos: "A \<ge> 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. 0 \<le> A
unfolding A_def u_def
by (rule cInf_greatest, auto)
lemma Alim:"(\<lambda>n. u n/n) \<longlonglongrightarrow> A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>n. u n / real n) \<longlonglongrightarrow> A
unfolding A_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>n. u n / real n)
    \<longlonglongrightarrow> Inf {u n / real n |n. 0 < n}
proof (rule fekete)

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>n m. u (m + n) \<le> u m + u n
 2. bdd_below {u n / real n |n. 0 < n}
show "bdd_below {u n / real n |n. 0 < n}"
unfolding u_def bdd_below_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>m.
       Ball {dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ n) (0::'a)) / real n |n. 0 < n} ((\<le>) m)
by (rule exI[of _ 0], auto)

proof (state)
this:
  bdd_below {u n / real n |n. 0 < n}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n m. u (m + n) \<le> u m + u n
fix m n

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n m. u (m + n) \<le> u m + u n
have "u (m+n) = dist 0 ((T^^(m+n)) 0)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. u (m + n) = dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))
unfolding u_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a)) =
    dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  u (m + n) = dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n m. u (m + n) \<le> u m + u n
also

proof (state)
this:
  u (m + n) = dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n m. u (m + n) \<le> u m + u n
by (rule dist_triangle)

proof (state)
this:
  dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))
  \<le> dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ m) (0::'a)) +
        dist ((T ^^ m) (0::'a)) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n m. u (m + n) \<le> u m + u n
also

proof (state)
this:
  dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))
  \<le> dist (0::'a) ((T ^^ m) (0::'a)) +
        dist ((T ^^ m) (0::'a)) ((T ^^ (m + n)) (0::'a))

goal (1 subgoal):

also

have "... \<le> dist 0 ((T^^m) 0) + dist 0 ((T^^n) 0)"
using semicontract_Tn[of m] add_mono_thms_linordered_semiring(2)

text \<open>The main fact to prove the existence of an asymptotic translation vector for $T$
is the following proposition: there exists a unit norm vector $v$ such that $T^\ell(0)$ is in
the half-space at distance $A \ell$ of the origin directed by $v$.

The idea of the proof is to find such a vector $v_i$ that works (with a small error $\epsilon_i > 0$)
for times up to a time $n_i$, and then take a limit by compactness (or weak compactness, but
since we are in finite dimension, compactness works fine). Times $n_i$ are chosen to be large
high scores of the sequence $u_n - (A-\epsilon_i) n$, which tends to infinity since $u_n/n$
tends to $A$.\<close>

proposition half_space:
  "\<exists>v. norm v = 1 \<and> (\<forall>l. v \<bullet> (T ^^ l) 0 \<le> - A * l)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>v.
       norm v = 1 \<and>
       (\<forall>l. v \<bullet> (T ^^ l) (0::'a) \<le> - A * real l)
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>v.
       norm v = 1 \<and>
       (\<forall>l. v \<bullet> (T ^^ l) (0::'a) \<le> - A * real l)
define eps::"nat \<Rightarrow> real" where "eps = (\<lambda>i. 1/of_nat (i+1))"

proof (state)
this:
  eps = (\<lambda>i. 1 / real (i + 1))

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>v.
       norm v = 1 \<and>
       (\<forall>l. v \<bullet> (T ^^ l) (0::'a) \<le> - A * real l)
have "eps i > 0" for i

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. 0 < eps i
unfolding eps_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. 0 < 1 / real (i + 1)
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  0 < eps ?i

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>v.
       norm v = 1 \<and>
       (\<forall>l. v \<bullet> (T ^^ l) (0::'a) \<le> - A * real l)
have "eps \<longlonglongrightarrow> 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. eps \<longlonglongrightarrow> 0
unfolding eps_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>i. 1 / real (i + 1)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> 0
using LIMSEQ_ignore_initial_segment[OF lim_1_over_n, of 1]

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<lambda>n. (1::?'a1) / of_nat (n + 1))
  \<longlonglongrightarrow> (0::?'a1)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>i. 1 / real (i + 1)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> 0
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  eps \<longlonglongrightarrow> 0

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>v.
       norm v = 1 \<and>
       (\<forall>l. v \<bullet> (T ^^ l) (0::'a) \<le> - A * real l)
have vi: "\<exists>vi. norm vi = 1 \<and> (\<forall>l \<le> i. vi \<bullet> (T ^^ l) 0 \<le> (- A + eps i) * l)" for i

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>vi.
       norm vi = 1 \<and>
       (\<forall>l\<le>i.
           vi \<bullet> (T ^^ l) (0::'a) \<le> (- A + eps i) * real l)
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>vi.
       norm vi = 1 \<and>
       (\<forall>l\<le>i.
           vi \<bullet> (T ^^ l) (0::'a) \<le> (- A + eps i) * real l)

text \<open>We can now show the existence of an asymptotic translation vector for $T$. It is the vector
$-v$ of the previous proposition: the point $T^\ell(0)$ is in the half-space
at distance $A \ell$ of the origin directed by $v$, and has norm $\sim A \ell$, hence it has
to be essentially $-A v$ by strict convexity of the euclidean norm.\<close>
